meanings.definition: The quality or state of being adamant.
meanings.sent1: Her adamance in sticking to her beliefs impressed everyone at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: His adamance in following the rules made him a reliable team member.
meanings.sent3: Despite her adamance, she couldn't resist trying the new dessert.
meanings.sent4: The adamance of the mountain against the storm was awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The adamance of the old tree roots gripping the earth was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act or state of being unyielding or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: The adamance of the old teacher in maintaining discipline was well-known.
meanings.sent2: Their adamance in following the schedule helped them finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat's adamance in sitting on the keyboard amused everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The adamance of the lock in keeping the door shut was frustrating.
meanings.sent5: The adamance of the stubborn door in staying closed was quite a challenge.
